qas.question: Between what time period did the reannexation of Germany occur?
What were French families forced to do during the German reannexation?
When did the suspension of German teaching in  schools happen?
When did teaching German cease to be an issue?
What did the French government force French family names to become?
1927 made what the language of education?
What did the French do contrary to their typical language policy?
What years did the Francization campaign run?

context: During a reannexation by Germany (<a0_0><b7_0>1940–1945<b7_0/><a0_0/>), <b5_0>High German<b5_0/> was reinstated as the language of education. The population was forced to speak German and 'French' family <a1_0>names were <b4_0>Germanized<b4_0/>.<a1_0/> Following the Second World War, the <a2_0>1927<a2_0/> regulation was not reinstated and the teaching of German in primary schools was suspended by a provisional rectorial decree, which was supposed to enable French to regain lost ground. The teaching of German became a major issue, however, as early as <b3_0>1946<b3_0/>. Following World War II, the French government pursued, in line with its traditional language policy, a campaign to <b6_0>suppress the use of German<b6_0/> as part of a wider Francization campaign.
